title: The Most Coherent Interpretation of Genesis 1-11 You've Ever Heard.
description:
This video summarizes the conclusions of a line of research that brings a unifying and coherent theme to the antediluvian history recorded in Genesis. This comprehensive view does not treat the accounts of these chapters as distinct events, but explains them in one continuous narrative 

Specifically this video deals with the personal narrative accounts of the people after Creation and the Fall and expulsion from the Garden of Eden, the stories of Cain and Abel (Genesis 4), the genealogies  of Cain and Seth, (Genesis 5), The Watchers and the Nephilim Giants (Genesis 6) the flood (Genesis 7-8) and the account of Noah's drunkenness (Genesis 9)

The full paper explaining this video is available here:
https://docs.google.com/document/u/2/d/e/2PACX-1vRz_vVkyNS6VsJwhO-p3Np70XsdNtZQ-2N3qQe9cuGqHrE9bdbF6QT169qjiPujBvr1tdro0IaHsDrc/pub

I also made a commentary/explanation video giving more of the details. 

https://youtu.be/Q-q7WDxci9c

This paper also reconciles the similarities and differences between the Genesis account and the account in the Book of 1 Enoch.

Hopefully this video will make its way to Jonathan Pageau, so he can add his symbolic interpretation of Genesis in light of how I put forth the events in this video. This would also likely enhance his effort to understand universal history. For my research, I relied mostly on the text of the bible, in preference to traditions, together with reason and logic. I also made this work in light of the monumental advancements in theology and biblical understanding made since the protestant reformation, which have brought freedom and joy to millions of Christians all over the world.  

Also credit goes to Michael Heiser, although I challenge one of his interpretations, I uphold his supernatural view of the events in Genesis 6, and in the light of the other events, the other views become indefensible.

transcript_parts.text: this is a narrative interpretation of
the events in genesis specifically from
genesis 4 to 9.
this represents what i have found to be
the most coherent and unifying
explanation of all the events that take
place in these chapters
i have written a long essay explaining
why this interpretation is biblically
sound
and a link will be included in the
description
[Music]
adam and eve are placed outside the
garden and banished to work the ground
god has made a series of consequential
changes to creation
not to punish the man and woman but to
put them on a path of restoration
anticipating the seed of the woman that
would redeem the now fallen world
eve gives birth to a son and names him
cain with the help of god
believing that this might be the
promised seed she also has another son
abel
in the course of time it becomes clear
that abel is the one god prefers
not cain
cain succumbs to spiritual temptation
listening to the lie of the enemy which
seeks to destroy the promised child and
he kills his brother abel
much like adam and eve being banished
from the garden of eden god takes away
cain's ability to grow crops
not simply to punish
but to set cain on a path of redemption
to wander off to a remote land and
accomplish other plans that god has for
him
adam and eve have another son seth
but this time the son is made in the
image and likeness of adam
clearly bearing a resemblance to his
father this is the seed of man
cain wanders to the east to a land
called nod
here he has children and his descendants
remain in relative isolation from the
greater part of humanity
cain's descendant lamech a fierce
patriarch who uses the power of
reputation to protect his family from
attack in an increasingly violent world
takes two wives
ada bears two sons
jabel the father of all who dwell in
tents and keep flocks
and jubal the father of all who play the
harp and flute
zilla
has a son tubal kane who is the forger
of bronze and iron tools and she also
has a daughter
nama
in the west
seth's descendants eagerly anticipate
the coming savior and great hope is
placed in enoch who walks with god
but enoch is removed from the earth
unless he returns he cannot be the
savior they are looking for
methuselah the son of enoch takes a wife
from the distant east
nama the daughter of lamech sister of
tubal kane
at some point angelic beings seeing the
beauty of the female form native to
humans but foreign to their kind
contrive a way to take these women as
wives
their superiority to mortal men makes
them prized as the match in the eyes of
women and of their fathers
the sons they bear are giants and mighty
heroes
however much like the mule the strength
of the hybrid comes at a cost
and these nephilim do not produce heirs
of their own
new daughters are rarely born into the
world and the balance begins to shift
methuselah and nama have a son and he is
named lamech after his maternal
grandfather
lamech learns the use of bronze and iron
tools from his uncle to bill kane and
passes it on to his son noah
hoping that this child could bring some
comfort into the ever worsening world
[Music]
noah grows up in an ever more
frightening world
despite the hope that his father has put
in him
noah struggles to find a wife to build a
life with as people have abandoned the
command that god gave them to be
fruitful and have instead labored in
attempts to make themselves equal with
god by sacrificing their daughters and
sons to demons and giants
women are rare and those who are raised
in the wicked centers of civilization
are educated early in perversion
hoping to give themselves to the
nephilim who always consume and never
bear fruit
in an effort to escape the wickedness of
the culture the patriarchs travel far to
the west all the way to the edge of the
continent where the land meets an
endless city
after 500 years noah finally finds a
woman to wed and in a short span she
bears him three sons
but then
she is gone
killed captured or seduced by evil we do
not know
god commands noah to build an ark
an enormous boat
and in this command tells noah that he
is to bring his sons his wife and his
son's wives with him
the world has become a corrupt and
desolate place
how can noah find women suitable to be
wives for himself and his family
the women who can be found have all been
corrupted
by the influence of sin
if a woman has already become one flesh
with a man
even if he is dead her children bear his
name
not the name of noah and his sons
noah begins to act in faith to do what
he can and trusts in the lord to provide
he begins the massive undertaking of
constructing the art
filling the massive trees that were
planted in the time of his forefathers
adam seth and enosh
as he works to store provisions and
complete the construction he finally
decides to send one of his sons eastward
to try to find suitable wives from the
line of his grandmother
nama
after the construction of the ark was
complete the lord spoke again to noah
telling him that in seven days the
waters of the flood would come and as
noah did everything in his power to
prepare he prayed to god for his son's
return
finally on the seventh day
his son returned with four young women
some were shepherdesses
leading the flocks of sheep and goats
cattle and other clean animals and clean
birds
and their cousins were playing flutes
and liars and behind them followed a
pair of every wild beast soothed and
made docile by the music
and so god reversed everything that he
had done in the first seven days
the women the final touch of creation
led the way
followed by the animals presenting
themselves two by two to noah as he
entered the ark
calling their names given to them by his
forefather adam
they entered into the ark filled with
the fruits from the trees of the garden
and where once they had lived among the
trees the trees had become a seed again
a shell containing all the potential for
life on the earth
god shut the door to the ark and the
waters came
reversing the whole of the earth to its
prior state formless and void
after a year of chaos and destruction
the seed found purchase in the soil
as the ark
rested on dry land and the inhabitants
of the ark came forth
noah and his wife who was pregnant and
his sons and their wives
noah treated his new wife with
gentleness and a bit of trepidation
perhaps because she was so young barely
a woman
and when the new child was born
noah looked with awe and wonder at the
child
[Music]
noah planted a vineyard from the
cuttings he had preserved on the ark
and when the child was weaned
he made wine from the grapes of his
vineyard and after drinking his fill he
approached the tent of his wife to
fulfill the command god had given to him
and his sons to be fruitful and multiply
he uncovered his nakedness the nakedness
of his wife
and as he succumbed to the effects of
the wine
fell asleep in the tent
ham
his son noticed what had occurred and as
he looked in he saw his father
unconscious and his wife
naked on the blankets that covered the
floor of the tent
he approached her and the shy girl did
not resist as he began to use her body
for his pleasure
he had already done this before on the
ark during the chaos and destruction
when his father had been preoccupied and
had been looking for another opportunity
to take advantage
when he had finished ham wanted to brag
about his accomplishment and so he told
his brothers shem and japheth
telling them how the girl would not
resist if they wanted to go in and have
some fun with her
but his brothers were distressed at what
he said and they grabbed a sheet placing
it over their shoulders and walked
backwards into the tent covering the shy
young girl and their father
when noah wakes up and learns what his
son ham has done he curses kanan the son
born by his wife
noah realized it once that the child was
not his
because he always knew that the child
was not his
he had taken the young girl to his
chambers in the ark but he had not
consummated the marriage
the lord had told him to wait until the
ark had landed as his sons would because
the other girls were even younger than
noah's bride
he was not in a hurry to become one
flesh with this young girl whom he had
met on the day she entered the ark and
he could tell she was nervous about
being married to a man who was nearly 50
times her age
so when noah discovered that the girl
was with child he thought it was a
miracle
he had deduced that the only sign that
would prove a child was the promised
seed of the woman
destined to crush the head of the
serpent and free humanity
must be born from a virgin
but now
noah felt a fool
he was ashamed of his hope and he would
let his sons continued thinking that he
had consummated his marriage on the ark
but he could not reward ham for his
wickedness and it would not be good for
the child to be raised by his natural
father
he had already shown signs that he was
not the promised child noah had hoped he
might be
but noah had tried not to worry
now it all made sense
conceived in wickedness the child would
need a good example to curb the
inclinations of his flesh
shem would take care of the child and
his mother and japheth as well
their families would be blessed through
this
noah lamented that he would not bear any
more children of his own
he could not take the girl to be his
wife now she had united herself to his
son
in the eyes of god they were one flesh
any women of the future generations
would be noah's granddaughters it would
not be right to take them as wives
so noah's line would increase through
the lines of his sons
through them alone would the whole earth
be filled
after this incident the mother of canaan
bore another child a daughter from ham's
second act of indiscretion
as noah looked on the young girl he was
glad that she may in time become a good
wife to one of his grandsons
perhaps to shem's new child arfak sad
this new world shattered and disjointed
yet cleansed from the wickedness of the
past would continue to wait in eager
anticipation for the seed of the woman
and noah felt that though he was wrong
about canaan he had rightly heard from
the lord and that through these wives of
his sons and their daughters
god had preserved the seed of promise on
the ark
the seed of the woman who would one day
be born of a virgin and would redeem
this broken world
[Music]
you
